document_notes.text:
This update for openssh fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2023-51385: Limit the use of shell metacharacters in host- and
  user names to avoid command injection. (bsc#1218215)

notes.text: In ssh in OpenSSH before 9.6, OS command injection might occur if a user name or host name has shell metacharacters, and this name is referenced by an expansion token in certain situations. For example, an untrusted Git repository can have a submodule with shell metacharacters in a user name or host name.
